isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HOOD SEALS

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9100
svcsubproc.para: The 9200 Model and 9100 Model do not have hood seals on the cab cowl.

svcsubproc.title: 9300 and 9400 (Before June 1994) - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and raise the hood to the full open position.
Drill out the rivets (Item 2) using a 9/64 inch (3.56 mm) drill bit. Remove the hood seal (Item 1) from the cowl flange (Item 3). Save the hood seal for installation, if not damaged.

svcsubproc.title: 9300 and 9400 (Before June 1994) - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Check the hood seal (Item 1) for cracks and tears; if damaged, replace it.
Position the new hood seal (Item 1) on the cowl flange (Item 3) and secure with 1/8 inch (3 mm) diameter, 3/8 to 7/16 inch (9.5 to 11 mm) grip range blind rivets (Item 2).
Close the hood and fasten the hood latches.

svcsubproc.title: 9400 (After June 1994)
svcsubproc.para: After June 1994, the 9400 Model does not have hood seals on the cab cowl.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and raise the hood to the full open position.
Drill out the rivets (Item 2) using a 9/64 inch (3.56 mm) drill bit. Remove the hood seal (Item 1) from the cowl flange (Item 3). Save the hood seal for installation, if not damaged.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Check the hood seal (Item 1) for cracks and tears; if damaged, replace it.
Position the new hood seal (Item 1) on the cowl flange (Item 3) and secure with 1/8 inch (3 mm) diameter, 3/8 to 7/16 inch (9.5 to 11 mm) grip range blind rivets (Item 2).
Close the hood and fasten the hood latches.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Optional Butterfly Hood - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and raise the left and right side hood to the open position, as required.

Drill out the rivets (Item 2) using a 9/64 inch (3.56 mm) drill bit. Remove the left and right side hood seals (Item 1) from the cowl flange (Item 3). Save the hood seals for installation, if not damaged.

Remove 1 screw and flat washer (Item 5) at the bottom of the left and right side hood seals (Item 1), then remove the hood seals by carefully pulling on the hood seals at each of the push-in fasteners to remove them from the radiator shell flange (Item 4). Save the hood seals for installation, if not damaged.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Optional Butterfly Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Check the hood seals (Item 1) for cracks and tears; if damaged, replace them.
Position the left and right side hood seals (Item 1) on the cowl flange (Item 3) and secure with 1/8 inch (3 mm) diameter, 3/8 to 7/16 inch (9.5 to 11 mm) grip range blind rivets (Item 2).

Position the left and right side hood seals (Item 1) on the radiator shell flange (Item 4) and secure with the push-in fasteners, then install 1 screw and flat washer (Item 5) at the bottom of the left and right side hood seals.
Close the hood and fasten the hood latches.
